intro: Lophopappus blakei, commonly known as Blake's goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by feathery bracts that aid in seed dispersal. Lophopappus blakei is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in low-nutrient soils.
